questions.question: Identify Hard vs Soft Shut-In procedures.
questions.answer: Hard Shut-In: Close choke first, pump down, close BOP, then open side outlet. Soft Shut-In: Open choke first, pump down, open side outlet, close BOP, then close choke.
questions.explanation: Hard = immediate BOP closure (fast but pressure spike). Soft = establish flow path first (slower but gentler).

questions.question: Soft shut-in choke manifold line-up?

options.A: Side outlet closed; choke line open; remote choke closed
options.B: Side outlet open; choke line through manual; remote open
options.C: Side outlet open; choke line through remote; manual closed
options.D: Side outlet closed; choke line through remote; remote open

questions.explanation: Soft shut-in routes through remote choke (ready to control) with choke OPEN initially to accept flow during BOP closure.

questions.question: Shallow gas is less dangerous because there's more reaction time. True or False?
questions.explanation: Shallow gas is MORE dangerous—less overburden, faster migration, rapid expansion, minimal time to react. The opposite is true.

questions.question: Hard shut-in choke manifold line-up?

options.A: Side outlet closed; choke through remote; remote closed
options.B: Side outlet open; choke through manual; remote open
options.C: Side outlet open; choke through remote; manual closed
options.D: Side outlet closed; choke through remote; remote open

questions.explanation: Hard shut-in: Everything CLOSED. Choke closed, side outlet closed. BOP closes against sealed system.

questions.question: Practices that increase influx size? (SELECT THREE)

options.D: Drilling 15 feet after break before flow check
options.F: Testing stab-in valves during BOP tests

questions.explanation: Disabled alarms (B) delay detection. Drilling after break (D) lets kick develop. Calling supervisor (E) wastes shut-in time. All increase influx volume.

questions.question: Soft shut-in while tripping - correct sequence?

options.A: Close BOP; open safety valve; close safety valve
options.B: Stab safety valve; open BOP side outlet; close BOP; close choke
options.C: Open side outlet; close BOP; stab safety valve; close choke; close safety valve
options.D: Stab safety valve; close safety valve; open side outlet; close BOP; close choke

questions.explanation: While tripping: First secure the string (stab valve, close it), then establish flow path (side outlet), then close BOP, then close choke. Secure string first!

questions.question: What does formation permeability affect during shut-in? (SELECT THREE)
questions.explanation: High perm = fast flow = quick stabilization (A), higher SICP (C, more influx), larger kick (E). BHP is formation pressure—permeability doesn't change it. SIDPP reflects formation pressure through mud column.

questions.question: Shallow gas diversion steps?

options.A: Slow pumps; space out; maintain constant BHP via choke
options.B: Stop drilling; increase pump rate; close diverter
options.C: Pick up; space out; switch off pumps; open downwind vent; close shakers valve; close diverter

questions.explanation: Shallow gas: DON'T shut in (can fracture). INCREASE pump rate to sweep gas away. Close diverter to direct flow to vent lines. Keep mud moving!

questions.question: Why is quick shut-in important?
questions.explanation: Fast shut-in = small kick. Small kick = easier to kill, less MAASP risk, less shoe pressure. SIDPP reflects formation pressure—won't change with speed.

questions.question: Well flowing while tripping. Action?
questions.explanation: Flowing = kick in progress. First secure the open pipe (stab safety valve), then shut in. Can't safely run back or install kelly with flow.

questions.question: SIDPP 530 psi, SICP 680 psi, 12.8 ppg mud. Gas migrates 600 ft. Expected pressures?
questions.explanation: Gas migration adds pressure equally to both. 600 ft × 12.8 × 0.052 = 400 psi. New SIDPP = 530+400=930. New SICP = 680+400=1080.

questions.question: Hard Shut-in procedure on floating rig?
questions.correctAnswer: Stop drilling, close BOP, open choke line valve then choke, adjust annular pressure
questions.explanation: Floating rig hard shut-in: Stop pumps, close BOP immediately, then establish flow path through choke for pressure monitoring.
